result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Assignment of Judge; resent to address provided by post office

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy I Redman not in court.  Attorney Gillion Parham in court for Jeremy I Redman.  (Ozaukee Co. 19PA9PJ)  Case called at 10:15 a.m.  Atty. Parham states she is aware defendant struggles with transportation but has no information for the court.  Court does not forfeit bond.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeremy I Redman appeared in court, Attorney Gillion Parham appeared in court for Jeremy I Redman. Clerk: EZ.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered.
Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeremy I Redman appeared in court, Attorney Gillion Parham appeared in court for Jeremy I Redman. Clerk: EZ.  WITNESS:  Officer Jason Pollard (WBPD).  State move bind over.  Atty. Parham objects to bind over.   Further argument by the State.  Court finds that a felony has been committed and probably by the defendant and order defendant bound over for trial and bail stands as previously set.
Arraignment scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with Fleet Farm. No contact with J.P. or B.B.

Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeremy I Redman appeared by zoom video, in custody at WC Jail, Attorney Andrew D Leech appeared in court for Jeremy I Redman. Clerk: EZ. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests $1,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Leech requests a signature bond and defendant is on a PO hold.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits NOT waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
